legal_basis: PRRA officers must consider new evidence that arose after the rejection of the refugee claim or was not reasonably available at the time of the hearing.
evidence_assessment: The PRRA officer reviewed submitted evidence, including a statutory declaration and briefs. She focused on new developments rather than rehashing prior hearings.
risk_of_persecution: Applicants claimed risk of persecution in Guatemala due to surname confusion with a former president.
decision_outcome: Judicial review application dismissed; no new evidence warranting reconsideration was identified.
procedural_fairness: After unsuccessful Refugee Protection Division and Federal Court reviews, applicants sought judicial review of the PRRA decision, arguing new evidence was ignored.
